field.name: summary
field.value: viewcomponent section won't be parsed if used in capturefor component

field.name: description
field.value:
this view template: <%@Page Language="C#" %> <component:capturefor id="anothercapture"> <component:ColumnRenderer items="<%=new int[]{1,2,3} %>"> <section:firstelement>section1</section:firstelement> <section:item>o<%=Properties["item"]%>o</section:item> </component:ColumnRenderer> </component:capturefor>
won't render properly because the parsing won't match the sections for "ColumnRenderer" instance but for "capturefor"

comment.author: gauthier
comment.text:
debugging further, the problem is the section regex matching (which should not match section in sub components).
any idea how to avoid section match if inside another component tag, is it doable with regex?

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: Tim Barcz is a regex master, we should ask him...

comment.author: TimBarcz
comment.text: Can you provide the current regex so I can have a look see.

comment.author: kenegozi
comment.text:
Lets start with a workaround: put the content of the CaptureFor in a separate subview, and call that subview from the CaptureFor's body.
Fixing this would be quite complicated, so unless we get a patch that solve this properly it probably won't be fixed.
I also am looking into allowing alternative approach for View Component code, using <% %> blocks and lambdas for bodies and sections. if it would be nice enough I'll advise on deprecating the xml-like syntax since the parsing code is quite hairy. It won't be happening any time soon though

comment.author: kenegozi
comment.text: Sorry, you'd have to use a workaround - move the CaptureFor's content to a subview
